It is on the United States border directly north of the earthquakes epicenter, not north and west of the epicenter. A corrected map can be found at nytimes.com/national.

title: Corrections
description: An article on Saturday about the contributions that guard Stephen Curry, a favorite for the National Basketball Association rookie of the year award, has made to the beleaguered Golden State Warriors misstated his age and the order in which he was drafted. He is 22, not 21, and he was drafted seventh over all, not fifth.

title: Corrections
description: Because of an editing error, an Associated Press report in the N.H.L. roundup in some editions on Wednesday about Philadelphias victory over the Toronto Maple Leafs misstated the Flyers lead over the Rangers in the Eastern Conference after Tuesdays games. It was 4 points, not 6.

title: Corrections
description: A picture caption in some editions on Monday with the Sports Briefing column misidentified the soccer player shown heading the ball in an English Premier League game. He is Mido of West Ham, not Leon Osman of Everton.

title: Corrections
description: A report in the Arts, Briefly column on Wednesday misidentified the conductor whom Steve White was scheduled to replace at the Metropolitan Opera for La Traviata on Wednesday night and for whom he will fill in again on Saturday night. He is Leonard Slatkin, who withdrew  not James Levine, who has been sidelined by a back problem but was not scheduled to conduct those performances.

title: Daimler, Nissan and Renault Join in Small-Car Alliance
description: PARIS  Renault, Nissan Motor and Daimler on Wednesday unveiled a strategic partnership to share small-car technology and power trains, in a move that comes as automakers are rapidly joining forces to cut costs.

title: A Career on the Edge
description: Manohla Dargis narrates a look at the career of Dennis Hopper.

title: Corrections
description: An obituary on Wednesday about the actor Corin Redgrave misstated a detail in the plot of In the Name of the Father, one of the movies in which he appeared. The movie was about four people falsely accused in the I.R.A. bombing of a pub in Guildford, England, near London  not a pub in London.

title: The Mets Fight Back on a Warm Night, but the Result Is All Too Familiar
description: In years past, the second home game of the year for the Mets was something best avoided. It was often cold and windy at Shea Stadium, with a few brave souls, amazed at how quickly the excitement and buzz from opening day had dissipated, shivering under blankets scattered around the vast park.

title: Correction
description: An Op-Ed article on Wednesday, about President Hamid Karzai of Afghanistan, incorrectly described Gen. Stanley McChrystals position. He is the top American commander in Afghanistan, not the head of Central Command.

title: Corrections
description: FRONT PAGE

title: Kyrgyzstan President Says He Will Not Step Down
description: MOSCOW  A transitional government in Kyrgyzstan declared that it was in charge on Thursday, a day after deadly protests forced the president to flee the capital. But the president himself insisted that he would not step down, issuing veiled threats from an unknown location that suggested the country, the site of a vital American military base, could face renewed instability.

title: CKEs New Mystery Bidder: Apollo
description: When CKE Restaurants said on Wednesday that it had received a new takeover offer that was likely to trump a $928 million bid from THL Partners, many investors and analysts questioned who the mystery bidder was.

title: 2 Are Hit, Benches Are Warned, and Players Laugh
description: BOSTON  It was only natural that at some point during the Yankees series with the Boston Red Sox, the umpires would warn the benches. It happens so often now that the participants laugh about it.

title: What Its Like to Be Yelled at by Tortorella
description: Erik Christensen scored two of the Rangers first three goals  including one just 21 seconds after the opening draw  in their critical 5-1 victory over the visiting Maple Leafs on Wednesday. The win kept the Rangers playoff hopes alive going into their season-ending home-and-away weekend series against the Flyers.

title: Obstacles Remain for the New G.M.
Backup iPhone Power in a Slim Device
description: After my recent article about how to maximize the battery life of a smartphone, I heard from many manufacturers of backup batteries hoping that I would mention their products.

title: Corrections
description: An article last Thursday about young gossip bloggers referred incorrectly to Fred Mwangaguhunga, the founder of MediaTakeOut.com. As the article noted, he is 36, so he started blogging in his fourth decade, not his third. The article also misstated the name of a former employer of Foster Kamer, a staff writer for the Village Voice news blog Runnin Scared. It is Blackbookmag.com, not BlackBook.com. And because of an editing error, the article referred incorrectly to two sisters-in-law who were the subject of a report in The Gloss. Minnie Mortimer, not Tinsley Mortimer, married the filmmaker Stephen Gaghan.

title: A Food-Photographing Phenomenon
description: WHO has posted nearly nearly 9,000 photos of what hes eaten on his Web site?

title: Assessing Response to Illegal Smoke and Quip
description: WASHINGTON  When an illicit pipe and a foolish joke aboard an airliner touches off a national megascare, scrambling fighter jets and F.B.I. agents, alerting all 4,900 flights in progress and unleashing a media flood, does that mean the security system works?

title: Word of the Day | chimerical
description: chimerical \ki-mer-i-kl, k-, -mir-\ adjective

title: News Quiz | April 8, 2010
description: See what you know about the news below. To prepare, you might scan the articles or summaries on todays front page.

title: Another Granderson Blast a Sign of Things to Come?
description: BOSTON  Just how many home runs will Curtis Granderson hit in 2010? That seemed a popular question after Granderson was traded to the Yankees, a move that assured he would get 81 games to take aim at Yankee Stadiums right-field porch. How about 30? Or 35? Maybe 40? More?

title: Fed Reviews Find Errors in Oversight of Citigroup
description: Citigroup ran into trouble under the noses of federal regulators. But even after taxpayers rescued the financial giant, regulators failed to monitor the company adequately, according to reviews by the Federal Reserve, Sewell Chan and Eric Dash report for The New York Times.

title: Hollywood Tries to Block Market for Movie Bets
description: In a show of solidarity, many of the film industrys major players, and some sympathetic lawmakers, have aligned in an 11th-hour push to block new financial instruments that would allow traders to swap contracts tied to box-office results, Michael Cieply and Joseph Plambeck write in The New York Times.

title: Pressure Builds on Greece as Europe Dawdles
description: With investors becoming increasingly worried about the failure so far of European officials to agree on the terms for loans to Greece, the main banks in Athens added another concern Wednesday by turning to the Greek government for more financial support, Matthew Saltmarsh and Niki Kitsantonis report in The New York Times.

title: S.E.C. Moves On Consumer Loan-Backed Bonds
description: Credit rating agencies would lose their formal role in evaluating certain bonds backed by consumer loans, like home mortgages, under rules proposed on Wednesday by the Securities and Exchange Commission. Instead, the companies issuing these bonds would have to vouch for their soundness.

title: British Airways and Iberia Seal Merger
description: British Airways and the Spanish airline Iberia have signed a merger agreement, formalizing a long-awaited deal to create one of the worlds largest airline groups to compete with rivals like Air France-KLM and Lufthansa, the companies announced Thursday, Nicola Clark reports in The New York Times.

title: Are You Optimistic About the Future of Your Country?
description: In Relax, Well Be Fine, Op-Ed columnist David Brooks writes the fact is, despite all the problems, Americas future is exceedingly bright. Whether you live in the U.S. or elsewhere, how do you feel about where your country is headed? Are you generally optimistic, or pessimistic? Why?

title: Start-Ups Fuel Growth in Super-Fast Trading
description: Tumbling technology costs have opened potentially lucrative ultra-fast trading strategies to tiny start-up players, fueling growth of the opaque and controversial business across Europe and the United States, Reuters writes.

title: JPMorgan Said to Double Tokyo Commodities Team
description: JPMorgan Chase has almost doubled the number of its Tokyo commodity traders to meet demand from utilities seeking to use coal-derivatives to hedge against price swings, said a person with knowledge of the expansion, Bloomberg News reported.

title: Plot Twists
description: Three novel solutions to the urban garden.

title: A Call for Fed to Raise Rates Unsettles Investors
description: Wall Street investors were rattled on Wednesday by the prospect of higher interest rates and new signs that consumers were reluctant to spend again, The New York Timess Javier C. Hernandez reported.

title: Geithner Warns E.U. on Hedge Fund Rules
description: Timothy Geithner, the head of the Treasury, has warned Britain, France, Germany and Spain about possible new European Union rules that he fears could prevent American hedge funds from selling to European customers, The Associated Press reported.

title: Banks Said to Sidestep Lawsuits From Crisis
description: Lawsuits leveled at banks as a result of the financial crisis are being dismissed in large numbers based on various forms of a global financial catastrophe defense that shifts blame to the weakened economy and away from the banks themselves, The Wall Street Journal reported.

title: U.S. Judge Seizes $105 Million in Argentine Funds
description: April 9, 6:24 p.m. | Updated Argentina quickly said it would file a court appeal after a federal judge in the United States ruled Wednesday that bondholders can seize $105 million in Argentine central bank deposits held in the United States. A bank spokesman told The Associated Press that Argentina was optimistic because similar rulings had been overturned.

title: A Timely Global Mosaic, Created by All of Us
description: Update, May 17 | It is now possible to search the Moment in Time interactive gallery by the name given in the photographers credit line (actual name, pseudonym or screen name, as the contributor chose). Youll find the search box in the upper right corner of the opening page. If you believe your picture wasnt posted, we urge you to give this a try.

title: Countries Urged to Plan for End of Stimulus
description: An international financial organization urged advanced economies on Wednesday to begin laying the groundwork now so that next year they could start removing economic stimulus measures, The New York Timess Matthew Saltmarsh reported.

title: China Said to Be Close to Announcing Currency Revision
description: The Chinese government is very close to announcing a revision of its currency policy in the coming days that will allow greater variation in the value of its currency combined with a small but immediate jump in its value against the dollar, people with knowledge of the consensus emerging in Beijing said Thursday, Keith Bradsher reports in The New York Times.

title: Russia and U.S. Sign Nuclear Arms Reduction Pact
description: PRAGUE  The United States and Russia opened what they called a new era in their tumultuous relationship on Thursday as they signed an arms control treaty and presented a largely united front against Irans nuclear program, marking a sharp change since they broke over the Georgia war two years ago.

title: Aeroflex Gears Up for $500 Million in I.P.O.

title: Prosecutors Seek 335 Years for Petters
description: 6:34 p.m. | Updated Tom Petters was sentenced to 50 years in prison, according to Bloomberg News.When the corporate empire of a Minnesota businessman, Tom Petters, collapsed, the losers in what prosecutors say was a $335 million Ponzi scheme included not just hedge funds, but at least 10 pastors, three missionaries, dozens of retirees and a half-dozen nursing home residents, according to federal court filings.

title: Miller Buckfire Chairman Joins A.I.G. Board

title: Mumbai Gets an Organic Market
description: Organic cotton: a sensible concept. Cotton candy: frivolous, but delicious. But organic cotton candy  these three words are not natural bedfellows. Nonetheless, the adventurous spirit of the Indian sweet tooth knows no bounds. Now, thanks to a new organic farmers market in Mumbai (Nilgiri Garden, Bandra Hindu Association, Linking Road, Bandra West), you can get a natural sugar rush  imagine eating a nimbus cloud that passed over a molasses factory  alongside local, pesticide-free food.

He is also the co-author of 13 Bankers.As we move closer to a Senate  and presumably national  debate on financial reform, the central technical and political question is: What would prevent any bank or similar institution from being regarded  ultimately by the government  as so big that it would not be allowed to fail?

title: Sampler: Californians May Ride Chinese Rails, and Time Limits on Wine Tasting
description: Looking to China for High-Speed Rail Technology | The Chinese government has signed preliminary cooperation agreements with California and General Electric to help build rail lines. Gov. Arnold Schwarzenegger of California has closely followed progress in the discussions with China and hopes to travel to China later this year for talks with rail ministry officials, said David Crane, the governors special adviser for jobs and economic growth, and a board member of the California High Speed Rail Authority. China is offering not only to build a railroad in California but also to help finance construction. Chinese officials have already been shuttling between Beijing and Sacramento to make presentations, Mr. Crane said. Meanwhile, discussions are set in San Jose on details of routes and station locations for the planned high-speed rail line connecting San Francisco and Anaheim. [The New York Times, The San Francisco Examiner]

But the mine escaped the stepped-up enforcement even though it continued to amass violations, federal records show.

In Taiwan, television viewers and Internet users are aflutter (and a-Twitter) over the latest homegrown star of a reality singing competition who, like Susan Boyle before him, shows you cant judge a book by its cover.

title: Soul Man
description: By age 12, I had a rote reply for grown-ups quizzical looks when they heard I went to a Waldorf school: Its based on the ideas of Rudolf Steiner. Blank stare. He was an Austrian philosopher who believed in teaching the whole student  mind, body and soul. Luckily no one ever asked me to elaborate, because Id have been at a loss for words  except to say that we students got to do lots of drawing and painting, which I loved, but we couldnt skip eurythmy class (yuck). any serious discussions of pedagogic method and what Steiner called his spiritual science, anthroposophy, took place out of earshot in the teachers room. My only mental picture of Steiner (1861-1925) came from a dim black and white photo showing a stern mouth and X-ray eyes that made me glad this guy wasnt our headmaster. Oh, well, I reasoned, as soon as I enter the real world after graduation, its Goodbye, Dr. Steiner.

title: U.S. Retailers Report Strong Gains for March
description: The nations retailers reported their strongest monthly sales growth in a decade on Thursday, with robust gains in virtually every category of merchandise and every type of store.

title: Introducing Staying Alive: What Its Like to Struggle
description: Its a sweltering August morning in Midtown Manhattan, and the loading dock foreman is cursing me for my terrible truck-parking skills. Yesterday I was here meeting my client, wearing a suit and tie and looking slick. Today I got up at 4 a.m. to drive the truck and deliver the job. Yesterday I went in the front door; today I take the freight elevator. Did I get demoted overnight? No, Im the boss. I need this delivery to go smoothly, and the recession has thinned my work force, so here I am  parking the truck.

title: Chrome Browser, Unhacked

title: Motion Comics Series Honors Americans Who Saved Jews
description: When superheroes team up in comic books, they typically combat a great evil. A similar approach is being undertaken with They Spoke Out: American Voices Against the Holocaust, a 10-episode series of motion comics. The project is a collaboration between Disney Educational Productions, the David S. Wyman Institute for Holocaust Studies in Washington and the veteran comic book artist Neal Adams. Each episode will highlight a rarely told story of Americans who helped rescue Jews from the Holocaust and include a mix of animation, traditional comic book art, period photographs and film.

Its provided by Lee Schipper, a longtime student of energy efficiency and transportation with positions at Stanford University and the University of California, Berkeley. title: New Hominid Species Discovered in South Africa
description: CRADLE OF HUMANKIND, South Africa  Nine-year-old Matthew Berger dashed after his dog, Tau, into the high grass here one sunny morning, tripped over a log and stumbled onto a major archaeological discovery. Scientists announced Thursday that he had found the bones of a new hominid species that lived almost two million years ago during the fateful, still mysterious period spanning the emergence of the human family.

The move would help ease tension with the Obama administration about the United States huge trade deficit with China.

title: Juggling Essays, Epics and Divas

They are looking for fans hiding after Wednesdays practice round, fans who hope to remain unseen until they can blend into the arriving crowd Thursday morning for the first round of the Masters.

title: Thursday Reading

title: Colleges Skirt Rules on Health Plans, Cuomo Says

title: New Cable Series for William H. Macy and Laura Dern
description: Is Showtime ceding its turf as the cable-television home for imperiled female protagonists? That channel  which is already home to a widow-turned-drug lord (on Weeds), a housewife with multiple personalities (The United States of Tara), that show where Carmela Soprano works at a hospital (Nurse Jackie), and is adding a show about a female cancer patient (The Big C)  said it was adding a new series that features a male lead. The Hollywood Reporter said Showtime had given a 12-episode order to Shameless, which stars William H. Macy (of Fargo and Broadways Speed-the-Plow) as the alcoholic head of a Chicago family coping with the recession. Their mother is absent from the scene, but an 18-year-old daughter (played by Emmy Rossum) brings some gender balance to the lineup.

title: The Pattern of Irish Sex Abuse
description: As a follow-up to last weeks posts on the historical trends in priestly sex abuse in the United States, Ive been trying to find similar data on the Irish sex abuse scandal. As far as I can tell, none of the many reports that have been issued in the last decade (the Ferns Report, the Murphy Report, etc.) contain a chronological accounting comparable to what the John Jay Report did for the American Catholic Church. (Though if Im missing something, please point it my way). The closest thing Ive found is the Commission to Inquire Into Child Abuses report on Irelands religious-run reform schools, which solicited claims of abuse from Irish-born adults educated in those schools between 1914 and 1999. Heres how Brendan ONeill, the editor of Britains Spiked Online, summarizes the findings:

They said President Bush did a better job throwing out the first pitch. But on the other hand, President Obama can talk.

title: Speedy Tax Refunds, but to Identity Thieves, Suit Says

title: Bobby Steggert, Kate Burton and Boyd Gaines to Star in New A. R. Gurney Play
description: Bobby Steggert will play a character A. R. Gurney based on his own younger self and Kate Burton will portray the stage actress who inspired him, in a production of Mr. Gurneys new play, The Grand Manner, for Lincoln Center Theater, the theater company said Thursday. The production will also star Boyd Gaines and Brenda Wehle. Mr. Steggert, who is coming off the recent production of Yank! at York Theater Company and was featured in the Broadway revival of Ragtime, will play Pete, a boarding school student who travels to New York and meets the actress Katharine Cornell (Ms. Burton, of The Constant Wife and The Elephant Man). Mr. Gaines (Gypsy, Journeys End) will play Cornells husband, the director Guthrie McClintic, and Ms. Wehle (Pygmalion, Come Back, Little Sheba) will play her manager, Gert Macy. The play, which stems from Mr. Gurneys real-life encounter with Cornell at a 1948 production of Antony and Cleopatra, will be directed by Mark Lamos. Previews at the Mitzi E. Newhouse Theater are scheduled to begin on June 1, with an opening night of June 24.
