description: SEOUL, South Korea  The South Korean military vowed revenge without identifying a target as the country gave an emotional farewell on Thursday to the sailors killed when their ship sank last month near a disputed sea border with North Korea.

title: Will E.U. Ruling Herald Hedge Fund Exodus?
description: Christopher Fawcett, a member of the hedge fund industrys largest trade group, told Bloomberg News that a crackdown by regulators in Europe has hedge fund managers across the zone mulling the idea of putting offices in areas like Hong Kong, Singapore and Switzerland.

title: Prudential Said to Get Korean Nod for AIA Deal
description: Prudential Plc, the British insurer, has secured South Korean antitrust approval for its planned $35.5 billion takeover of the American International Groups Asian life insurance business, a Korean Fair Trade Commission official told Reuters on Thursday.

title: Buying Serenas Handbag
description: Television viewers who crave Serenas handbag on Gossip Girl or Los dress on The Hills have been able to log on to SeenON, a Web site that identifies and links to other sites that sell the clothes that stars wear onscreen.

title: Why I Keep Joining Business Groups
description: My first experience with a business group came about 20 years ago, when I tried to assemble my own. In theory, it seems like this should be an easy thing to do. Its not. It is very hard to find enough people to get a group going  even if youre not charging anything. And even if you do get it going, it can be difficult to keep it going. It feels like a full-time job because it is a full-time job  one that I wasnt very good at and didnt have time to do. My do-it-yourself group lasted less than a year and did not have the benefit of the resources that professional groups have, including the ability to recruit new members.

title: Best Defensive Tackles in N.F.L.: The Top 10 List
description: Friendly Disclaimer: The following list is influenced largely - but not strictly - by film study of all 32 teams from the 2009 season. It is not a prediction for the 2010 season, though the future isnt ignored. Stats werent acknowledged, but players with poor numbers generally dont make top 10 lists anyway. Vague enough for you? Top 10 lists tend to be. Thats why most of you will have no trouble finding some disagreement with what youre about to read.

title: No Cash? No Problem!
description: No cash? No problem. I accept mobile phones too.

title: Omers Said to Cut Out Middlemen in Talks for I.S.S.
description: Canadian pension fund Omers is close to edging out four private equity firms by acquiring the port and shipping group Inchcape Shipping Services, The Financial Times reported.

description: Q.

title: E.U. Says, Greeces Needs Will Be Met on Time
description: Jos Manuel Barroso, the president of the European Commission, said in a statement issued on Thursday in Brussels that European Union officials were doing all they could to ensure that loans were soon provided to Greece, James Kanter reports in The New York Times.

title: City to Overhaul Special Education
description: Heres what were reading this morning.

title: One Firm Refused to Aid a Goldman C.D.O. Plan
description: A little-known investment firm has found itself caught up in the Securities and Exchange Commissions fraud case against Goldman Sachs, The Wall Street Journal reported.

title: Sampler: Proposition 8 Trial to Return; Antioch Cancels July 4 Celebration
description: Date Set for Proposition 8 Trial Final Arguments | Same-sex marriage supporters and opponents, mark your calendars. Closing arguments in the federal trial to determine if Californias same-sex marriage ban violates the Constitution have been scheduled for June 16. After hearing testimony in January, Chief Judge Vaughn R. Walker of United States District Court for the Northern District of California wanted a break to review evidence before hearing closing arguments. But that break stretched out as Equality California and the American Civil Liberties Union fought turning over internal documents from the 2008 campaign against Proposition 8 to the measures supporters. On Tuesday, the groups agreed to supply the documents.[The Associated Press]

title: Speed Read for Thursday, April 29
description: Here are some highlights from Thursdays edition of The New York Times:

title: Putting a Value on Explosive Plays, and Why Brandon Marshall Is a Dolphin
description: The beating took place Monday, Sept. 21, 2009, in Miami. The perpetrator, the Dolphin offense, ran all over the victim, the Colt defense. Forty-nine times for 239 yards, to be exact.

title: Mullins Receives Another Suspension
description: Jeff Mullins, who last year at this time was trying to get the Kentucky Derby morning-line favorite I Want Revenge healthy enough to run in Americas greatest race, was suspended 30 days Wednesday for a TCO2 violation  commonly known as milkshaking a horse  in 2008, according to the California Horse Racing Board.

title: Chechen President Denies Involvement in Critics Shooting Death
description: MOSCOW  Chechnyas president denied accusations by the Austrian government that he was involved in the shooting death of a Chechen whistle-blower in Vienna last year, saying Thursday that he was the victim of a smear campaign.

title: 4 Ways to Keep an iPad Secure and Private
description: The iPad is a new and wonderful plaything, but its also a mini-computer that holds large amounts of your personal and private information in e-mail messages, contact lists, photos and apps for social networks and other services. And so its wise to think about how to keep this private information private should you lose your iPad or leave it unattended for a spell, or if it gets stolen.

title: Q. and A.: Vying for a Role as Climate Chief
description: Not long after the much-anticipated but decidedly unsuccessful climate talks in Copenhagen last December, Yvo de Boer, head of the United Nations climate secretariat since 2006, announced he would resign, effective July 1.

description: Republicans conceded Wednesday night to allow Democrats to bring their financial regulatory legislation to the Senate floor, bowing to mounting political pressure after blocking debate of the measure thee days in a row.

title: Strike Interrupts Flights by Lebanese National Carrier
description: Pilots at Lebanons national carrier are striking at Beirut International Airport to press demands for improved working conditions. About 170 Middle East Airlines pilots began their 24-hour strike at 3 a.m. Thursday.

title: A Catastrophe Delayed
description: I was rereading the spectacularly mistimed Jonung and Drea paper mocking American economists who were skeptical about the euro, and went back to what I wrote in 1998. Heres how I described the ugly American critique:

title: Art and Commerce in Delhi
description: IN 2008 New Delhi-based Subodh Gupta, known for sculptures created from hundreds of pieces of shiny kitchenware, joined the tiny list of Indian artists whose work has sold for over a million dollars. In Delhi, it seems, art has become good work if you can get it. But if million-dollar sculptures are out of your league, you can still admire the stuff at one of a series of new spots around the city dedicated to the business of marrying art with, well, business.

title: Found Poem Favorite | It Was Absurd
description: Todays poem, chosen from nearly 200 submissions to our Found Poem Student Challenge, comes from Elizabeth, who is 16 years old and lives in Onalaska, Wash.

title: Burundis Freewheeling Nights
description: AS rumors of a failed coup attempt swirled in the muggy evening air of Bujumbura, the capital of Burundi, no one seemed inclined to let them dampen the mood.

title: The Answer, My Friend
description: is blowing in the wind off Cape Cod, where an offshore wind farm has been approved. Good  both substantively and in terms of perception. The spectacle of affluent clean-energy advocates getting all worked up at the prospect of actually putting windmills where they might see them played right into right-wing caricatures. Lets hope thats now over.

title: Neil Barofsky: Keeping the Bailout on Target
description: Theres a reason there are Tea Partiers out there, and when you look at it, anger at the bailout is one of the first things they talk about, Neil Barofsky told Bloomberg News. This Treasury Department and the previous Treasury Department bear some of the responsibility for not being straightforward with the American people.

title: In Final British Debate, Economy Is the Focus
description: BIRMINGHAM, England  Nick Clegg, the Liberal Democratic leader, had to show that he is more than a fresh-faced flash in the pan. David Cameron, the leader of the Conservatives, had to prove that underneath his silky facade lurks a serious prime minister in waiting.

title: The Masters Tour
description: Picture yourself in the great rooms of the 20th century. And then decorate them. View slide show>>

description: MALIBU, Calif.

title: Q. and A. With Steve Davidowitz
description: Steve Davidowitz is author of Betting Thoroughbreds, a seminal work on handicapping that introduced the concepts of track bias, key races and the value of identifying trainer patterns. It has sold 150,000 copies worldwide in more than 20 printings while influencing generations of horseplayers.

title: Summoning Mr. James at Pratt
description: The other day I had the pleasure of being a juror at the student fashion presentation at Pratt Institute. We met at Milk Studios, roughly 30 of us, to choose the best designs for the graduation show on May 13. Among my fellow jurors were the costume designer William Ivey Long, the style legend Iris Apfel, and Eric Gaskins, a former designer who now has a blog. We each were assigned to a panel  I got evening wear and bridal.

title: Prof. Rock Star Urges Muslim Students in Queens to Rock Out
description: Some professors act like rock stars, but my professor really is one, Tejkaran Kaur, a student at Queens College, said recently.

title: Whats Next for Goldman Sachs?
description: Peter J. Henning follows issues involving securities law and white-collar crime for DealBooks White Collar Watch.

title: Life Skills Every Child Needs
description: You may have heard about Ellen Galinskys latest book, Mind In The Making. It may well be the next iconic parenting manual, up there with Spock and Leach and Brazelton, one that parents turn to for reassurance that all is more or less okay, reminders of how to make it better and glimpses of whats to come.

title: Bits: Buying Serenas Handbag
description: Delivery Agent, which runs runs e-commerce sites for networks and studios like ABC, CBS, NBC, Fox and HBO, will begin working with TV and movie companies to sell clothes and other items that appear in shows and movies. Entertainment companies hope the sales will encourage more people to watch the shows when they are broadcast. Read more on the Bits blog

title: Lost and Found, but Whose Ball Is It?
description: Al, Bruce, Chuck and Dave arrive at the most difficult hole on the course, a long par four with thick woods to the right and left of the hole.Al hits his drive deep into the left woods and without making any announcement hits another ball down the middle of the fairway.

title: A Set You Could Call Home
description: Santo Loquasto narrates a look at his design for the Broadway play "Collected Stories."

title: Q. & A. With Julie Sahni (Round One)
description: Julie Sahni is the owner of Julie Sahnis Indian Cooking School inBrooklyn Heights, N.Y., and the author of 10 cookbooks, including SavoringHerbs and Spices and Classic Indian Cooking. She istaking questions on how to prepare Indian food. Please write them in thecomments below and she will answer them throughout the week. Related article.

title: The Case for and Against Lookin at Lucky
description: Lane Gold, the former director of Derby spin at Churchill Downs, is based out of New York and is still actively involved in racing. He co-hosts a weekly radio show, the Kentucky Winners Circle, and has a blog called Lane One.

title: On Character: Connie Britton and Kyle Chandler in 'Friday Night Lights'
description: The actors discuss their onscreen marriage and a scene from the small-town drama.

title: Philip K. Dicks Exegesis Will Receive Two-Volume Release
description: After a lifetimes worth of literature that explored the future, the farthest regions of space and the afterlife, a posthumous work by Philip K. Dick will take readers to a different alien terrain: the inside of the authors mind.

title: Adviser to Cuomo Is Also Top Lobbyist
description: ALBANY  Jennifer Cunningham is one of this citys most prominent lobbyists, best known for her advocacy on behalf of 1199/S.E.I.U. United Healthcare Workers East, arguably Albanys most powerful special interest.

title: In Jail, Hate Crime Killer Says He Isnt So Hateful
description: RIVERHEAD, N.Y.  He was at times reflective and apologetic, humble and hopeful. He sat in a beige booth behind the plexiglass separating inmate and visitor, leaning down low to talk into the speaker hole.

title: The Morning Line: Unlucky Post Positions
description: The post position draw for the Kentucky Derby definitely established a theme for the media coverage, and much of the coverage today (and there was a ton of coverage) focused on the unfavorable post position draws for the favorite Lookin at Lucky and the second choice Sidneys Candy. Papers throughout America and the U.K. focused on the unfavorable draws including The Times, Daily News, NY Post, Boston Globe, Louisville Courier-Journal, Boston Herald, and USA Today. The Racing Post in the U.K. understatedly describes Bob Baffert as making no attempt to disguise his disappointment after favourite Lookin At Lucky was handed the unfavorable draw right on the inside rail in gate one of 20 in Saturdays race.

title: Financial Reform and the Perils of the Center
description: In the debate over financial reform, the Senate G.O.P. seems to be proceeding the way Democrats and a large swathe of the chattering class wanted them to proceed on health care reform. For most of the way, theyve been the party of yes, if  rather than the party of no, using the limited powers of the minority to ease the bill in their direction, rather than trying to defeat it outright. As a result, it seems likely that FinReg will pass with more than a few G.O.P. votes, having been amended in ways that address at least some conservative concerns. You can chalk this compromise up to pure political self-interest  financial reform is much more popular than health care reform and everybody knows it  or to the fact that the ideological stakes are lower on these issues than they were on health care. But either way, the Republicans have behaved extremely responsibly on the issue, at least as the Beltway consensus defines responsible.

title: 'That Girl' Meets 'Mad Men'
description: A look at some of the inspiration behind Scott Pask's set designs for the Broadway revival of "Promises, Promises."

title: China Passes Tighter Information Law
description: BEIJING  Chinas legislature has imposed tighter requirements on Web and telecommunications companies to shield the nations state secrets, which are often defined as including a broad array of information the authorities deem detrimental to security.

title: Sarkozy Urges China to Back Iran Sanctions
description: BEIJING  President Nicolas Sarkozy of France told President Hu Jintao of China that nations would have to impose new sanctions on Iran if it refuses to curb its nuclear program, official Chinese news organizations reported on Thursday.

title: Later Today: Live Video of Final British Debate
description: On Thursday, the leaders of Britains three largest political parties will face-off for a third and final time in a televised debate, one week before election day. Here on The Lede, will have a live video stream of the action from Birmingham, England, courtesy of The BBC. The debate gets underway at 8:30 p.m. local time, which is 3:30 p.m. ET.

title: Better Place Opens Battery-Swap Station in Tokyo for 90-Day Taxi Trial
description: Wherever the electric-vehicle infrastructure company Better Place has planted its flag, withering vaporware accusations have followed. They were natural rejoinders to the assured pledge of Shai Agassi, its chief executive, at last falls Frankfurt motor show to put 100,000 electric vehicles on the worlds roads by 2016.

title: Q&A: The Osa Peninsula in Costa Rica
description: Q.

title: Civil Rights Leader Is Eulogized by Obama
description: WASHINGTON  President Obama eulogized the civil and womens rights leader Dorothy Height on Thursday as a drum major for freedom, describing her as an American icon who tirelessly pursued justice.

title: Obamas Remarks at Dorothy Heights Funeral Service
description: Following is a transcript of President Obama's remarks on Thursday at the funeral service for civil rights leader Dorothy Height, as released by the White House:

title: Ovechkin Out
description: It is at once the beauty of the N.H.L. playoffs and their downfall. Their unpredictability makes the games enthralling  nothing can be taken for granted, every momentum swing potentially epic. But then, yes, you wake up one day before the end of April and the games most magnificent player and best regular-season team are gone from the scene, gone from the airwaves, Washingtons having been dispatched by a Little Montreal Team That Could.

title: Euro Rises After I.M.F. Increases Aid Pledge to Greece
description: European stocks rose modestly and the euro halted its decline Thursday, a day after the International Monetary Fund promised to increase the 45 billion euro aid package for Greece to as much as 120 billion euros over three years to quell the I.M.F.s biggest crisis since the Asian woes of 1997.

title: Florida's Senate Spectacle
description: MIAMI  Gov. Charlie Crist announced Thursday that he will run independently for the United States Senate, giving Florida a race that will once again make the state a gawk-worthy stage of American politics, where the country's desires, fears and conflicts play out.

title: Mcaffocalypse
description: Nickname given to the ill effects of a faulty McAfee anti-virus update.

title: TimesCast | April 29, 2010
description: A look inside The New York Times newsroom and stories being covered Thursday.  Today's topics include tensions over the oil spill cleanup, apartment envy on Broadway and more.

title: When Cold Fingers Mean Raynauds, or Worse
description: Maria Vigilante was a freshman at Temple University in 2002, pursuing dreams of becoming a concert violinist, when the chills first settled into her fingers. One cool September day, while climbing into her car, she noticed that the tip of her right index finger had turned white. Within weeks, similar blanching began to occur in all her fingers and toes.

title: Toyota Offers a Fix for S.U.V.s Control Problems
description: Toyota said Thursday it had resumed sales of the Lexus GX 460 after fixing a problem with the stability control system that could cause the luxury sport utility vehicle to roll over.

title: Woods Ends First Round Two Over Par
description: CHARLOTTE, N.C.  Tiger Woods wanted a return to normalcy when he arrived for the Quail Hollow Championship after a five-month odyssey of revelation and regret in his personal life.

title: Joys of the Window Seat
description: Readers shared photos of their favorite window seat views.

title: White House Takes a Bigger Role in the Oil Spill Cleanup
description: NEW ORLEANS  The response to the oil spill in the Gulf of Mexico intensified abruptly on Thursday, with the federal government intervening more aggressively as the rapidly growing slick drifted ever closer to the fragile coastline of Louisiana.

title: Scenes from 'The Sweet Cheat'
description: Images from Jeff Stark's site-specific work.

title: Getting to the Root of Raynauds
description: Dr. Fredrick Wigley is a professor of medicine at Johns Hopkins School of Medicine and director of the Johns Hopkins Scleroderma Center. A rheumatologist, he has been studying Raynauds since 1978.

title: Expo Offers Shanghai a Turn in the Spotlight
description: SHANGHAI  The Worlds Fair may have lost the luster it brought decades ago to world capitals like Paris. But China has dusted off the concept in an attempt to give its second city, Shanghai, the same coming-out party that the 2008 Summer Olympic Games were for Beijing.

title: What to Ask About Raynauds
description: Confronting a new diagnosis can be frightening  and because research changes so often, confusing. Here are some questions you may not think to ask your doctor, along with notes on why theyre important.

title: Survivor Recounts Horror of Attack in Newark Schoolyard
description: NEWARK  She lay face-down on the pavement, trying in terror to follow the orders of those who had already robbed and molested her. Somebody had their knee on my back, she said, when suddenly, They pulled my hair up and was trying to chop my neck off with a machete.

title: Selected Studies: Raynauds Phenomenon
description: Government agencies, universities and corporations frequently enroll patients in studies designed to test the effectiveness of new drugs, procedures and medical devices. Participants may benefit by gaining access to experimental therapies, and they make an important contribution to scientific research. For more information, visit ClinicalTrials.gov, a service of the National Institutes of Health.

title: 5 Things to Know About Raynauds
description: Having a chronic condition like Raynauds requires vigilance. Here are five things that you should know about your condition from rheumatologists who treat it.

title: Finger Painting With Pixels
description: First, lets admit that the smell of freshly peeled crayon rubbed on construction paper can never be replaced by any form of technology.

title: Fueling the Anger of Doctors
description: At a recent social gathering, a doctor friend who has been in private practice for almost 15 years revealed something that caused one physician to nearly choke on her drink, another to gasp in disbelief and the rest of us to stop what we were doing and gawk as if he had committed some grave social faux pas.

title: On This Oregon Trail, Pioneers Embrace Organic Wine
description: CARLTON, Ore.

title: Text-Blocking Apps
description: David Pogue examines apps that lock phones to keep them from being used by drivers.

title: Ex-Officer Convicted of Lying About Confrontation With Cyclist
description: A former police officer was convicted on Thursday of lying about a collision with a bicyclist who was taking part in a Critical Mass ride in Times Square in 2008  an altercation that was videotaped and became a viral presence on the Internet.

title: Europe Acts Swiftly on Long-Delayed Greek Bailout
description: BERLIN  European leaders raced Thursday to complete their part of a long-delayed financial rescue package for Greece, hoping to head off a chain reaction against other heavily indebted European nations that could turn into a financial meltdown across the continent.

title: Now Onstage, Spaces to Lust For
description: WATCHING the new Broadway production of Collected Stories, Bethany Millard felt transported back to a free-wheeling, happy time in her life, when she lived on Horatio Street in Greenwich Village in the early 1990s. A wistful sort of envy came over her, she said, as she saw the main character, Ruth Steiner, at home in a Village apartment of 12-foot-high bookshelves, cozy furniture and tasteful curios.

title: Children of Suicide Victims Are Vulnerable
description: Children whose parents commit suicide are almost twice as likely to kill themselves as those whose parents are still alive, according to a study based on data from Sweden.

title: Behavior: Addicted to Indoor Tanning
description: When you wake up in the morning, do you want to use a tanning bed or booth?

title: Live Video of the British Leaders Debate
description: Thursday's final televised debate among the candidates to be Britain's next prime minister begins at 8:30 p.m. in Birmingham, England (3:30 p.m. Eastern time). Thanks to The BBC, which is broadcasting the debate, we have a live video stream of the encounter here. For commentary and analysis of the debate as it happens, open another window in your browser and read our live updates as you watch the action.

title: Latest Updates on the British Leaders Debate
description: Live updates have moved here.

title: Welcoming Spring in Texas Tones
description: SURE, spring has arrived in the Northeast now in all its rosy, fragrant glory. In years past Ive followed it up the East Coast, from the hospitable gardens of Charleston to the emerald steeplechase country of Virginia to the postcard cherry blossoms of the Tidal Basin in Washington to the delicately scented walls of lilac in western Massachusetts.

title: Love and Cartagena
description: IN the deep recesses of the Basurto market, a man is shaving the face of a pig. A razor in his hand, he glides across its face to remove the fuzz. The pig will soon be dinner. Not far away, cow hearts are on sale, and beside them cow eyes, staring out ominously, bound for a hearty potage. A shopping cart full of limes whizzes past. Alcatraz birds loom on the corrugated-tin roofs. My Sweet Lord is playing in one corner; in another, Caribbean songs pour from a bar lined with drinkers. It is not yet noon.

title: Hotel Review: Hotel Saint Cecilia in Austin, Tex.
description: THE BASICS

title: Congress Sets Hearing on Expanded Oversight of Auto Safety
description: DETROIT  Congress will hold its first hearings next week on proposed legislation that would strengthen the enforcement powers of federal auto regulators, and require automakers to install a series of safety features on their vehicles.

title: 82 Charges Added On for Officer
description: OTTAWA  Col. David Russell Williams was once among Canadas most successful military officers. He commanded a sprawling air base essential for Canadas military mission in Afghanistan, and he sometimes was the pilot of government jets that carried Prime Minister Stephen Harper and other dignitaries overseas.

title: Text-Blocking Apps Only Work if You Use Them
description: In my Times column Thursday morning, I reviewed cellphone apps that prevent you from calling, texting or e-mailing when youre driving. I noted that theyre far from perfect solutions. For one thing, they work only on BlackBerrys and Android phones at this point-a tiny percentage of all phones. And they cant distinguish between the motion of you, the driver, and the motion of you, a passenger in someone elses car or even on a train or a bus.

title: Text-Blocking Apps Only Work if You Use Them
description: In my Times column this morning, I reviewed cellphone apps that prevent you from calling, texting or e-mailing when you're driving. I noted that they're far from perfect solutions. For one thing, they work only on BlackBerrys and Android phones at this point-a tiny percentage of all phones. And they can't distinguish between the motion of you, the driver, and the motion of you, a passenger in someone else's car or even on a train or a bus.

title: Local Stop: Gowanus
description: The Gowanus neighborhood of Brooklyn is becoming one of the citys newest cultural outposts.

title: A Canal Zone Comes Into Its Own
description: The Gowanus neighborhood of Brooklyn, the citys latest industrial desert turned cultural outpost, makes for a pleasant afternoons wander. The namesake canal, while it holds tons of poisonous stuff, is serene and calming. Things still do get a little post-apocalyptic: the weird drone of a cement factory, wide empty streets dotted with used condoms, a lone cormorant perched on the bank of a Superfund site. But with its historic bridges, canoeing club, low-slung buildings and growing selection of restaurants (Ethiopian, anyone?), Gowanus is laid-back and friendly. And markedly accessible: Jump off the B, D, M, N, Q, R, 2, 3, 4 or 5 trains at the Atlantic/Pacific station and head down Fourth Avenue from the Williamsburgh Bank tower to start your day in big-sky country.

title: Watching the Final British Leaders Debate
description: The Lede followed Thursdays debate among the leaders of Britains three largest political parties as it happened, with insights and observations from three British correspondents: John Burns, Alan Cowell and Stephen Castle. Their rapid reaction news analysis is below, with notes on the subjects discussed by the three leaders. In another post on The Lede, we have video highlights of the debate, courtesy of Britains Channel 4 News.

title: Happily Lost in the Luberon
description: WE walked down the middle of a street in LIsle-sur-la-Sorgue as if wed wandered in from the set of The Discreet Charm of the Bourgeoisie. My five friends and I had come to this village in the Luberon, a collection of small hilltop towns in sun-baked northern Provence, to roam through its famed antiques stores before dinner. But we soon realized  to paraphrase Peter Mayle, the author of A Year in Provence  that here you can find everything except a bargain. And so we were walking toward a restaurant instead. And not just any restaurant, but a place I had heard tell was the regions up-and-coming gem. The only problem? It was proving difficult to find.

title: Where Isolation Is a Perk, and the Point
description: LAST May, on the tiny tropical resort island of Nikoi, Peter Timmer sat at an open-air, thatched-roof bar, holding an icy cocktail glass. It was a perfect day in paradise: clear sky, turquoise water as far as the eye could see, and a warm, salty breeze. With the leathery skin of a lifelong sailor and a mellow grin, he was a Robinson Crusoe-esque character who didnt want to be rescued.

title: F.D.A. Approves Vaccine to Fight Prostate Cancer
description: The Food and Drug Administration on Thursday approved the first treatment that uses a so-called cancer vaccine, a drug that trains the bodys own immune system to fight the disease.

title: 36 Hours in Beirut
description: WANT a Beirut investment tip? Concrete. Thanks to a couple of years of political calm, the palm-fringed Middle Eastern city is bingeing on new buildings and cultural projects. A fast-expanding night-life strip, an upstart design district, new hotels and the countrys first contemporary art museum have all sprouted in the last few years. And theyre certainly not going unnoticed. A record number of travelers showed up to discover Lebanon and its capital in 2009. If the peace holds, look for an even bigger swell this year.

title: Book Review: Grounded: A Down to Earth Journey Around the World
description: Circling the planet felt too easy for the journalist Seth Stevenson and his girlfriend, Rebecca. To reconnect with the primal vastness of the earth, they decided to go only by pre-Wright Brothers transport, renouncing the jets lofty perspective for the more sluggish and archaic ship, train, bicycle, motor scooter and automobile.

title: Lesson Plan Technical Difficulties
description: The lesson we would have published this afternoon, Do You Speak My Language? Considering the Relationship Between Language and Culture, is delayed due to technical troubles that affected all the Times blogs today. Well publish it tomorrow afternoon instead.

title: The Case of the Back-Seat Bag
description: My cousin and I went out for the evening. I invited a friend to join us. At the end of the night, which included one too many alcoholic beverages, my cousins very distinct and expensive designer handbag was missing. A month later, I noticed the same bag in the back seat of my friends car. She tried to tell me that a boyfriend bought it for her  in a city where the designer doesnt even have a store. Now its uncomfortable, especially since she wears the bag everywhere she goes. Should I confront her, or just steal it back?

title: Pogues Posts: Apps to Prevent Distracted Driving
description: In my New York Times column this morning, I reviewed cellphone apps that prevent you from calling, texting or e-mailing when youre driving. I noted that theyre far from perfect solutions. For one thing, they work only on BlackBerrys and Android phones, which is, at this point, a tiny percentage of all phones. And they cant distinguish between the motion of you, the driver, and the motion of you, a passenger in someone elses car or even on a train or a bus.

title: Street Smart
description: New York streets usually offer mere glimpses into peoples apartments and town houses, so it isnt every day that you walk past a storefront and realize that youre staring straight into someones living room  and dining room and kitchen. Which is just fine with this apartments owners, the fashion designer Lela Rose and her husband, Brandon Jones, a hedge fund manager. Along with their two young children, the couple lives happily on view to their downtown neighbors in an expansive ground-floor space (plus parts of two subterranean floors) that was designed by Amale Andraos and Dan Wood, the founders of the seven-year-old company Work Architecture.

title: What Rhymes With Technical Difficulties?
description: On Poem-in-Your-Pocket DayCity Room came to play

title: Florida Democrat Seeks Offshore Oil Hiatus
description: Senator Bill Nelson, the Florida Democrat, has drafted legislation that would suspend the Obama administrations plan to move forward with offshore exploration and drilling for new oil deposits until a full investigation of the Gulf of Mexico explosion and spill is completed and new protocols developed to prevent future accidents of this sort. This is probably only the beginning, given that the oil has yet to reach coasts. Heres the draft language:

title: For Cuban Eatery, Unwanted Hiatus and Uncertain Future
description: The ghost town of empty buildings and fenced-in lots dotting Columbia Universitys proposed Manhattanville campus was joined by one more specter on Tuesday  Floridita Restaurant, shuttered.

title: Thoughts From Steve Jobs on Flash
description: 9:40 a.m. | Updated  Added response to Apples letter from Adobe.

title: The Frick and Other Grand Private Galleries
description: THE private art gallery is the most recondite of urban structures anybody can pick up a few Rembrandts, but who can afford a whole building to put them in?

title: A Tool Only as Good as the User
description: To the Editor:

title: A Museum's Former Life
description: Christopher Gray visits the Frick Collection and finds remnants of its former life as a home.

title: The Silence of the Tour Buses
description: Saturdays arent Saturdays on the Upper West Side without the booming voice at 72nd Street: In 1980, John Lennon was shot right here in front of the Dakota. On Bleecker Street, some neighbors are so tired of hearing the spiel on Picassos giant Bust of Sylvette that they have started wearing earplugs.

title: Oh, Boy: Lennons Lyrics for A Day in the Life for Sale
description: It was 43 years ago today, give or take, that a series of real-life events and everyday occurrences, including a newspaper article about the numerous potholes in the British town of Blackburn, Lancashire, inspired John Lennon and Paul McCartney to write what would become the final song on Sgt. Peppers Lonely Hearts Club Band and one of the Beatles best-known recordings. And for a sum that could probably pay for the restoration of more than a few bumpy British roads,Lennons original handwritten lyrics for his part of A Day in the Life could be yours: Reuters reported that at an auction on June 18 Sothebys would sell the single sheet of paper on which Lennon composed his verses, starting with the famous line, I read the news today, oh boy.

title: In Performance: 'Everyday Rapture'
description: Sherie Rene Scott performs an excerpt from her 2010 Broadway show.

title: Help the Governor, or Ride the Roller Coaster?
description: Attention all you Badge-holding, gleefully scolding Netizens! Gov. David A. Patersons Office of Taxpayer Accountability wants your help with the state budget.

title: A Canal Zone Comes Into Its Own
description: The Gowanus neighborhood of Brooklyn, the citys latest industrial desert turned cultural outpost, makes for a pleasant afternoons wander. The namesake canal, while it holds tons of poisonous stuff, is serene and calming. Things still do get a little post-apocalyptic: the weird drone of a cement factory, wide empty streets dotted with used condoms, a lone cormorant perched on the bank of a Superfund site. But with its historic bridges, canoeing club, low-slung buildings and growing selection of restaurants (Ethiopian, anyone?), Gowanus is laid-back and friendly. And markedly accessible: Jump off the B, D, M, N, Q, R, 2, 3, 4 or 5 trains at the Atlantic/Pacific station and head down Fourth Avenue from the Williamsburgh Savings Bank tower to start your day in big-sky country.

title: Innocent
description: Nat, September 30, 2008

title: An Emotive Oedipus in Stravinsky Festival
description: Stravinsky, who scorned emotions in art and said  among his many, sometimes contradictory pronouncements  that music was powerless to express anything at all, described his opera-oratorio  Oedipus Rex  as austere. The first audience certainly found it dour after the excitement and exoticism of his ballets. But while Stravinsky aimed for ironic detachment, the work can seem vividly theatrical and even emotive, as it did in the striking interpretation conducted by Valery Gergiev with the New York Philharmonic at Avery Fisher Hall on Wednesday evening, part of the orchestras festival The Russian Stravinsky.

title: The Plaza Hotel Gets Its Own Perfume
description: With luxury hotels customizing their bath collections and creating exclusive scents for their lobbies, it was only a matter of time before one came out with a signature body perfume.

title: Save Greece, Protect Germany
description: China is to the world as Germany is to Europe.

title: A Man With a Dead Wife on His Hands
description: Readers of Scott Turows engrossing 1987 novel,  Presumed Innocent,  will be startled to learn that in the sequel to that thriller, his hero, Rusty Sabich, now 60, is still married to Barbara, his volatile, unhappy wife, and that hes now the chief judge of the State Court of Appeals.

title: Hot Off the Presses: A Jungle Gym
description: While the days of the printed newspaper may be numbered, it continues to inspire a generation of  playground equipment designers. Thats right. On Wednesday, the Parks Department unveiled a new jungle gym at Printers Park in the Bronx that is shaped like the first rotary printing press, invented in 1846 by Richard March Hoe, whose former estate the park now occupies and who lent his name to Hoe Avenue, the street that runs by the park, in the Longwood neighborhood. It is part of a $1 million overhaul of the park, made possible through City Councilwoman  Maria del Carmen Arroyo.

title: Answers About New York School Data, Part 2
description: Following is the second set of responses from Robert Gebeloff, a computer-assisted journalist with an expertise in education who has been working on an extensive database of New York education statistics.

title: A Studio Is Added to a Cronkite Portfolio
description: VERA GIBBONS agreed to buy her one-bedroom apartment at  860-870 United Nations Plazaon one condition: that Walter Cronkite come to her Christmas party. He did.

title: Toy Executives Apartment Sells
description: LYNN PRESSMAN RAYMOND was a successful woman in a mans world  and in a childs world, too. For some 20 years, starting in the late 1950s, she was the chief executive of the Pressman Toy Corporation.

title: Bringing Out the Mummies at the Bass Museum
description: To expand audiences for cultural attractions in grim economic times, why not bring out a corpse or two, preferably from ancient Egypt?

title: Tweaking a Name in Long Island City
description: Anniversaries and expansions are often a time of reflection. In the museum world they are also an occasion for rebranding. To mark the 10th anniversary of the merger between the P.S. 1 Contemporary Art Center in Long Island City, Queens, and the Museum of Modern Art, P.S. 1 has changed its name to simply MoMA PS 1.

title: Photo of the Week
description: A jet is silhouetted against the full moon in St. Petersburg, Russia.

title: Medieval Remnants of the Jews in Spain
description: Trick question: What world-changing event happened in 1492 involving Queen Isabella of Spain? If you answered, The Jews were expelled from Spain by edict of the queen and her husband, Ferdinand II, you probably have an uncommonly high history I.Q. You probably also know that Isabella and Ferdinand had started the Spanish Inquisition 14 years earlier in an effort to ferret out Jews who had ostensibly converted to Christianity but continued to practice Judaism in secret.

title: Works That Span a Century and a Variety of Modern Moods
description: Just before the Chiara String Quartet played Weberns Five Movements for String Quartet on Wednesday evening at Le Poisson Rouge, the groups first violinist, Rebecca Fischer, pointed out that the work was 101 years old. There was a sense of wonder in her tone  an unspoken subtext that seemed to ask, Can you believe that people still hear this antique as harsh modernism? Ms. Fischer added that for her, the movements are five tiny landscapes.

title: Susan Boyle Tops Global Sales Chart
description: When American album sales for last year were tallied up, Taylor Swift edged out Susan Boyle, below, for the No. 1 spot. But Ms. Boyle has the last word when it comes to the global charts. Her debut, I Dreamed a Dream, was the most popular album around the world, with 8.3 million sales, according to a new report by the International Federation of the Phonographic Industry, a trade group based in London. I Dreamed a Dream, released in late November, beat out not only Ms. Swifts album, Fearless, which placed fourth in global sales, but also The E.N.D. by the Black Eyed Peas (No. 2) and the soundtrack to Michael Jacksons This Is It (No. 3). Jackson was the best-selling artist over all, with 22.9 million album sales around the world; five of his titles are in the Top 20. The best-selling digital single of 2009 was Lady Gagas Poker Face, with 9.8 million sales. (The Black Eyed Peas Boom Boom Pow was tops in the United States, with 4.7 million downloads, according to Nielsen SoundScan.)

title: Warning to Parents: Dont Try This at Home
description: A marital tiff begins Parents Evening, a two-hander by Bathsheba Doran that opened Thursday night at the Flea Theater. A full-bore argument consumes much of the second act. In between there are needling, squabbling and generalized passive aggression.

title: Kennedy Casting Set for TV Mini-Series
description: The Kennedys, the coming History channel mini-series, has found its lead actors to play the central members of the family. Greg Kinnear, top left, an Academy Award nominee for As Good as It Gets, will play John F. Kennedy; Barry Pepper, top right, (Saving Private Ryan) will play Robert F. Kennedy; Tom Wilkinson, above left, an Emmy Award winner for John Adams, will portray the family patriarch, Joseph P. Kennedy; and Katie Holmes, right, (Batman Begins, Dawsons Creek) will play Jacqueline Kennedy. The mini-series, produced by Joel Surnow, a creator of the Fox action series 24, has been criticized by historians who were provided early drafts of the scripts by the filmmaker Robert Greenwald, who has made liberal-leaning documentaries. The historians said the scripts had historical inaccuracies and presented an unflattering picture of President Kennedy and his family. History plans to show the eight-hour mini-series next year.

title: Knocked for a Loop on the Road
description: Midfielder Yael Averbuch helped lead Sky Blue F.C. to the championship of Womens Professional Soccer in the leagues first season. Averbuch, a Montclair, N.J., product by way of the University of North Carolina, will be filing to the Goal blog during the defending champions 2010 season.

title: Basking in Triumph, Unfurling Parasol Pop
description: V. V. Brown spent the last few moments of her show at the Bowery Ballroom on Wednesday night in recap mode, shoring up a narrative one bullet point at a time. Im going to tell you a story about my life, she said as her backing band struck up a groove, and what followed was a testimonial, or maybe the foundation of a personal mythology.

title: Polanski Lawyers Seek Prosecutors Testimony
description: Lawyers for Roman Polanski filed a motion in Los Angeles County Superior Court on Thursday seeking access to the sealed transcript of testimony by a prosecutor, Roger Gunson, about a judges sentencing plan in the 33-year-old sex case against Mr. Polanski. The motion contends that Mr. Gunsons testimony would prove that an extradition request filed with Switzerland last year included a false depiction of the sentencing plan by Judge Laurence J. Rittenband. The request said that Judge Rittenband sent Mr. Polanski to prison in 1977 for a psychiatric study so he would be in a better position to reach a fair and just decision before sentencing, while Mr. Gunson, according to Mr. Polanskis lawyers, has testified that Mr. Polanskis prison stay was to constitute his entire sentence. Prosecutors have argued in court that the extradition request was an accurate portrayal of events. Mr. Polanskis lawyers said that Swiss officials needed access to the sealed transcripts to fairly determine whether Mr. Polanski should be sent back to the United States, which he fled in 1978 before sentencing for having sex with a minor. A hearing on the motion was set for May 10.

title: Fun With Feathers and Bones
description: Combine some of the materials in Dead or Alive at the Museum of Arts and Design, and youd have a potent witchs brew. A single piece by Tessa Farmer, for instance, makes use of a ram skull, a mummified frog and bat, bladderwort, hedgehog spikes, weasel skulls, a spider web and sections of a wasps nest. (Another sinister-sounding substance, volcanic ash, delayed the pieces installation; it will be up by Tuesday.)

title: For Some, Tiger Fatigue Has Set In
The Poet as Gardener and Tiger Lily
description: Emily Dickinson once called herself a a Lunatic on Bulbs, referring to her passion for daffodils, hyacinth and other spring perennials, which she raised indoors in winter in her family home in Amherst, Mass. And a lunatic she probably seemed to neighbors who spied her gardening by moonlight on summer evenings in the flower beds behind the house.

title: U.S. Seeks to Revamp NATO Treaty in Europe
description: BERLIN  Spurred by a new treaty with Russia to reduce strategic nuclear missiles, the United States and NATO are seeking to revive a major treaty on conventional weapons in Europe, according to Anders Fogh Rasmussen, NATOs secretary general.

title: Puerto Rican Lenders Face Their Own Crisis
description: The latest American banking crisis is taking shape far from Wall Street and the empty subdivisions that stretch across the Sun Belt.

title: New Shades of the Blue and the Gray
description: WASHINGTON  Of the Civil War, there is no end. So exhibitions commemorating the 150th anniversary of its beginning might seem superfluous. In recent decades hasnt the Civil War been in almost continuous commemoration? It is now considered to be as central an event in the history of the United States as the Revolutionary War. Its key documents  all of them Lincolns, including the Gettysburg Address, the Emancipation Proclamation and the Second Inaugural Address  have become as fundamental for understanding American ideals as anything written by the founding fathers.

title: Of Guns and Bicycles
description: This just in: The federal Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco, Firearms and Explosives on Thursday released its annual report on guns recovered in crimes in New York.

title: Marylands Civil War Country Seeks a Softer Side
description: BOONSBORO, Md.

title: Viacoms Profit Up 37% as Ads Return
description: An increase in advertising revenue and higher fees from cable affiliates helped Viacom report a 37 percent gain in first-quarter profit on Thursday.

title: Publisher to Release Philip K. Dicks Insights Into Secrets of the Universe
description: After a lifetimes worth of literature from Philip K. Dick that explored the future, the farthest regions of space and the afterlife, a posthumous work will take readers to a different alien terrain: the inside of the authors mind.

title: Kidding the Clowns Online, but Who Will Laugh Last?
description: EVEN for guys who paint their faces with clown makeup and rap about brutality and dead bodies they found in the streets, the past few months have been strange for Insane Clown Posse. After proudly representing the horrorcore rap scene for nearly two decades, this hip-hop group, consisting of the Detroit natives Shaggy 2 Dope and Violent J, is enjoying a resurgence in attention  if not popularity  from Internet videos poking fun at their music and their harlequin-faced fans, who call themselves Juggalos.

title: Take Five: Dr. Faustus and DJ Similak Chyld
description: Wondering what to do this weekend? We have you covered.

title: Rough Morning? It Could Have Been Worse
description: So maybe you overslept, and the coffee you gulped on the way out the door did not jump-start your brain. Maybe you had to wait for what seemed like an eternity until the subway came. Maybe you accomplished very little all morning. (See caffeine, lack of, above.)

title: Video Highlights of the Final British Debate
description: During Thursdays final televised debate among the candidates to be Britains next prime minister, we had live video of the encounter here on The Lede, from The BBC, which broadcast the debate. Now that the encounter has ended, we excerpts from the debate courtesy of Britains Channel 4 News. To read some of the rapid reaction news analysis of the debate filed to The Lede by my colleagues John Burns, Alan Cowell and Stephen Castle, during the event click here.

title: One Womans Truth: Rielle Hunter Talks to Oprah
description: Rielle Hunter, who told Oprah Winfrey in a program broadcast on Thursday that John Edwards had a secret affair with her because he wanted to live a life of truth, is a tough interview, tougher in some ways than President Mahmoud Ahmadinejad of Iran.

title: The Cottages at Cypress Point
description: WHAT New section of a popular residential resort.

title: Holding Up a Mirror to Women, Thorns and All
description: The last words in Please Give, Nicole Holofceners latest comic drama of spiky manners, are youre welcome. Theyre uttered by Kate, a New York malcontent played with complex appeal by the wonderful actress Catherine Keener. Kates daughter, Abby (Sarah Steele), a stridently truculent teenager, has in a rare instance of filial generosity just thanked her mother for agreeing to pay for a pricey pair of jeans. From the near-beatific look on Kates face, it seems that after struggling to make amends for some vague, unarticulated wrong  by doling out cash to homeless people, for instance  she has found her moment of grace.

title: Dance Listings
description: DANCE

title: Museum and Gallery Listings
description: ART

title: Think Blankfein Will Resign? Want to Bet?
description: Goldman Sachs, if you listen to Congress, is little more than a casino where gamblers masquerade as traders and bet on the fortunes of the rest of us. Well, now the rest of us can bet on Goldman.

title: Jazz Listings
description: JAZZ

title: A War Ended, but, It Turns Out, Crime Didnt
description: Its like a gift from the gods, though in this case we have only the programmers at the British network ITV to thank. After canceling Foyles War, one of the best mysteries on television, in 2007, they did an about-face, and a three-episode seventh season begins on Sunday night on PBSs Masterpiece Mystery!

title: Classical Music/Opera Listings
description: CLASSICAL

title: Pop and Rock Listings
description: POP

title: Retiree With Gun Seeks Young Thugs
description: Charles Bronson, meet Michael Caine, who in Harry Brown matches you vigilante move for move in the annals of big, bad, bloody, disreputable entertainment. Sir Michael has prowled down other mean streets several times before in his storied career, notably as a shootin-tootin gangster out to avenge his brothers death in Mike Hodgess hard-boiled 1971 thriller, Get Carter. Now 77, Mr. Caine no longer conveys the cold brutality he once did. But he brings a plausible suggestion of steeliness (and a familiar gift for waterworks) to his role in this flick as the titular former military man turned trigger-happy pensioner.

title: Spare Times
description: AROUND TOWN

title: Pictures of the Day: Washington, Elsewhere
description: Like all distinguished photojournalists, Doug Mills just seems to have a knack for breaking out of pack situations  even pack situations as highly controlled as those in Washington. Think of his picture of Senator Edward M. Kennedys burial ceremony last August. On Thursday, Mr. Mills showed that flair again in what seems to be a remarkably introspective moment for President Obama.

title: Spare Times: For Children
description: PETER PAN

title: Movie Listings and Film Series
description: MOVIES

title: Reaction to Crists Decision
description: The decision by Gov. Charlie Crist to run as an independent not only upended the Florida Senate race, but also raised fresh questions for the midterm election year  and beyond  about the direction of the Republican Party. But Republican leaders in Washington sought to play down any divisions in the party and cast Mr. Crists decision as a politically craven one.

title: 10 of the Moment | Rufus Wainwright
description: With so much art and artifice swirling about him (read more here), Rufus Wainwright proved the perfect candidate for our 10 of the Moment. We caught up with him in on tour in Oxford, England.

title: Theater Listings: April 30  May 6
description: THEATER

title: Entry System Isnt Broke, but Fix It Anyway
description: Patrick Patten, author of the blog Handride, is part of a group called the Thoroughbred Bloggers Alliance.

title: Conan OBrien Opens Up About NBC Departure
description: In his first interview since walking away from NBCs Tonight Show," Conan OBrien tells 60 Minutes Sunday night that he believes he was not given a fair chance to prove he could succeed and that money may have been the reason NBC decided to bring Jay Leno back to late-night television.

title: Europes Debt Woes Start to Complicate Chinas Money Moves
description: HONG KONG  Spreading problems in Europes sovereign debt markets pose potential challenges for China, which has been stepping up its investments in European government bonds and relies on Europe as its biggest export market.

title: Finally, DealBook Is Back in Business
description: DealBook and its sibling blogs on nytimes.com were down since midmorning because of severe technical problems with our blog publishing system. (Be glad the Nasdaq doesnt run on our system.) Now were back, but the system is still a bit troubled, so posting will be light this evening.

title: Iran Reformist Tries to Enlist Labor and Teachers
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon  The Iranian opposition leader Mir Hussein Moussavi released a video statement on Thursday calling on workers and teachers to join the reformist cause, in a bold new attempt to broaden and energize the countrys flagging protest movement.

title: All the Picassos in the Cupboard
description: When in doubt, haul the Picassos out. There have already been several such haulings-out this year, and now comes the biggest of all, Picasso in the Metropolitan Museum of Art, a display of nearly every scrap in the Mets scrappy Picasso collection: 34 paintings, 58 drawings, a dozen sculptures and ceramics, along with 200 of the museums 400 prints.

title: Goldman: Still Greedy, No Longer Patient
description: Once upon a time, Goldman Sachs raison detre was to serve the ongoing needs of its clients and be paid fees for helping them raise capital, trade blocks of stock or by providing merger and acquisition advice, a business strategy that made the firm for years the envy of Wall Street and immensely profitable. This strategy forced Goldmans bankers to be long-term greedy  a shopworn phrase coined by a former senior partner, Gus Levy  and to do everything possible to stay in their clients good graces in order to have a legitimate shot at the next fee. While it was not exactly backbreaking  or the Lords  work, from one year to the next nothing was assured unless the Goldman partnership maintained that fragile bond of trust.

title: United-Continental Deal Is Said to Be Near
description: United Airlines and Continental Airlines are in advanced discussions on a merger after making progress on how to price the transaction, people briefed on the matter said Thursday.

title: A Gang of One
description: Michael Caine discusses his role in "Harry Brown."

title: Emily Dickinsons Garden
description: Images from an exhibit at the New York Botanical Garden.

title: 2010 Rolls-Royce Ghost
description: The introduction of a new Rolls-Royce is enough of a rarity to be an occasion.

title: Iowa Bird Story
description: In the second part of the Continental Picture Show series, Alec Soth sets out to take a worthy photograph for a 114-year-old Iowan.

title: Names of the Dead
description: The Department of Defense has identified 1,037 American service members who have died as a part of the Afghan war and related operations. It confirmed the death of the following American yesterday:

title: A.P. Board Elects New Members
description: Michael Golden, the vice chairman of The New York Times Company, and Katharine Weymouth, the publisher of The Washington Post, have been elected to the board of The Associated Press, the news cooperative announced on Thursday.

title: Popcast: Melissa Etheridge, Okkervil River and Mary Gauthier
description: This week: Jon Caramanica and Ben Sisario discuss Melissa Etheridges career and her 10th album, Fearless Love; Jon Pareles on True Love Cast Out All Evil, a collaboration from the psychedelic rock pioneer Roky Erickson and the alternative country band Okkervil River; and the folk singer Mary Gauthier performs live and talks to Ben Sisario about her new CD, The Foundling. Sia Michel is the host.

title: For Jobless Chefs, a Helping Hand
description: ON a recent Thursday night, after most of the dinner crowd had left, Bernard Ros, the owner and chef of Meli Melo, a French bistro in Manhattan, grilled three steaks, threw together a few pasta dishes and salads and pulled out two bottles of Ctes du Rhne red. By 10 p.m., he and a half-dozen friends in the restaurant business who were done working for the night  a couple of owners, a headwaiter, a wine salesman, a chef  were seated around a table in the back, talking jobs.

title: What the Spill Means for Offshore Drilling
description: Updated, Apr. 30, 3:15 p.m. | Coast Guard officials were investigating reports that the oil had washed ashore early Friday morning. President Obama ordered a freeze on new offshore drilling leases until an investigation was completed on the oil rig explosion and new safeguards were put into place.

title: A Semi-Star Torn Between Two Superstars
description: Just as the Broadway theater season is drawing to its close, a smashing little show has arrived to remind us of why so many of us keep going back to Broadway, even though its broken our heart so many times.

title: What Would Johnny Appleseed Say?
description: The marketer responsible for some of the wackiest new-media campaigns that ever sold bushels of mens grooming products is at it again.

title: Brandon Victor Dixon to Play Ray Charles on Broadway
description: The actor Brandon Victor Dixon, who received critical praise for his leading role in the Off Broadway musical The Scottsboro Boys this spring, will depart that production to take the lead role of Ray Charles in the forthcoming Broadway show about the singer, Unchain My Heart: The Ray Charles Musical.

title: Amanda Blackwell and Maj. Andrew Gallo
description: WHEN Amanda Blackwell of Columbus, Ga., first met Maj. Andrew Gallo in 2004, he mentioned having gone to West Point. She knew so little about the Army then that she thought he meant a small Georgia town called West Point.

title: Product Red Steps Up Its Efforts With Lazarus Effect
description: Product Red is introducing a campaign intended to increase awareness for its efforts to work with companies to develop products that help efforts to fight AIDS in Africa.

title: Freddy Krueger Is Back, With Sharp Claws and a Long Memory
description: Remember me? This is one of the half-clever, trailer-ready catchphrases (Lets play tag: youre it!, Fooled you! and so on) uttered by Freddy Krueger in the newly rebooted Nightmare on Elm Street. But really who, apart from Freddys terrified and bewildered new victims, could have forgotten? This maniac, with his jaunty hat and striped sweater, his ravaged face and murderous bladed glove, has been a fixture of pop culture for more than a quarter century.

title: United and Continental Reported Closer to Merger
description: United Airlines and Continental Airlines are in advanced discussions on a merger after making progress on how to price the transaction, Michael J. de la Merced and Jad Mouawad of The New York Times report, citing people briefed on the matter.

title: Putting a Limit on Tarmac Time
description: A new rule to protect airline passengers from being held on a plane on the tarmac for too long went into effect today. The rule, issued by the Department of Transportation, was announced in December after a series of cases on various airlines left passengers stranded on the tarmac for hours without being able to get off and, in some cases, without food, water or working toilets. In one case, 47 passengers were trapped overnight on a Continental Airlines flight in August 2009 after thunderstorms forced the plane to divert to Rochester, Minn.

title: Walk, Run or Maybe Nap for a Cure
description: The season of expending heartbeats for good causes is upon us.

title: Teachers and Crist: Will It Last?
description: MIAMI The teachers stood up front and on stage with Gov. Charlie Crist as he announced Thursday that he would run for the Senate without a party affiliation. For a campaign starting over without institutional support, they were a show of force  but will they last?

title: Vain Glorious | Kyoku Sake Infused Shave Crme
description: Who:Asim Akhtar

title: All That Japanese
description: The actress Amra-Faye Wright talks about learning Japanese in order to play Velma in a Japanese production of "Chicago."

title: U.S. Outlines Plan to Curb Violations of Labor Law
description: In a move that will affect most American corporations, the Labor Department plans to require companies to prepare and adopt compliance plans aimed at ensuring they do not violate wage, job safety and equal employment laws.

title: The Evening Skate: Caps Learn the Hard Way
description: (and check out the version by co-writer, Carole King)

title: Leno: Explosives in His Luggage
description: Monologue |  Wednesday night on The Tonight Show With Jay Leno on NBC: If youre planning on celebrating Cinco de Mayo in Arizona this year, might want to change your plans.

title: Iowa Bird Story
description: In the second part of the Continental Picture Show series, Alec Soth sets out to take a worthy photograph for a 114-year-old Iowan.

title: In Europe, a Delicate Decision on Rates
description: FRANKFURT  Europes collective anguish over Greece was interrupted by some good news on Thursday. German unemployment fell more than expected, while earnings surged for some of the countrys biggest companies.

title: Planning to Build? Not in His Backyard
description: Furry Vengeance, directed by Roger Kumble (Cruel Intentions), sets itself apart from most funny-animal movies by using live animals, albeit with a lot of computer graphics and green-screen help. An actual raccoon plots the harassment of Dan Sanders (Brendan Fraser), the construction manager for a green housing development that will in fact wipe out an entire forest; actual skunks climb into his S.U.V. to do what skunks do. Unlike animated animals, they dont talk; instead, they squeak and growl in ways that approximate human speech, or at least playground exclamations. If they could talk, theyd be on the phone firing their agents.

title: Letterman: All the Bad Decisions
description: Monologue |  Wednesday night on The Late Show With David Letterman on CBS: George W. Bush has his new memoir coming out in November, and its called Decision Points. Its about big decisions in his life. And Ive already made a decision not to buy Decision Points.

title: Democrats Outline Plans for Immigration
description: WASHINGTON  A coalition of top Senate Democrats laid out the contours of a proposed overhaul of immigration laws on Thursday  and appealed to Republicans to join them in pursuing it  even as doubts mounted about the prospects of winning approval of legislation this year.

title: High-Five Etiquette
description: Video | Slap me some skin, man  correctly:

title: Taking Inventory as Death Approaches
description: No amount of splenetic ranting by Brian Cox, a wonderful actor, when given the right role, can salvage The Good Heart from terminal mawkishness. When his curmudgeonly character, Jacques, the worlds most misanthropic owner of its seediest dive, lets fly, geysers of offensive epithets erupt from his mouth like Old Faithful on double time.

title: Joe Drapes Kentucky Derby Picks
description: The horses in the 136th Kentucky Derby on Saturday in Louisville, Ky. The Churchill Downs oddsmaker Mike Battaglia set the morning line. The horses are listed in order of preference.

title: A Call for Transparency in Awards Voting
description: Its a rare moment when a player wins a coveted award and his coach complains about the outcome. But it happened last week when Dwight Howard was named the N.B.A.s defensive player of the year.

title: In Abuse Crisis, a Church Is Pitted Against Society and Itself
description: VATICAN CITY  As the sexual abuse crisis continues to unfold in the Roman Catholic Church, with more victims coming forward worldwide and three bishops resigning last week alone, it is clear the issue is more than a passing storm or a problem of papal communications.

title: Novelist Loses His Heart to His Critic
description: Had John Cassavetes directed Love Story, it might have turned out looking and sounding something like Mercy, a portrait of a sub-Mailer-like literary pugilist and the woman (named Mercy) who wins his heart. Odd as that juxtaposition may seem, its not a bad mix. The movie, directed by Patrick Hoelck and starring Scott Caan, who wrote the screenplay and served as one of its producers, may be something of a vanity project. (It is his third produced screenplay, after Dallas 362 and The Dog Problem.) But it allows Mr. Caan to deliver a complex portrait of a womanizing bully with a cream-puff heart.

title: Diamondbacks Face Backlash Over Immigration Law
description: CHICAGO  The fight over Arizonas illegal-immigration law came to the sidewalk outside Wrigley Field on Thursday afternoon, in the shadow of a game between the Arizona Diamondbacks and the Chicago Cubs.

title: Keeping Score: Many Games, Few Innings
description: Sean Forman is the creator of Baseball-Reference.com, an online baseball encyclopedia of players, teams and box scores in the major and minor leagues.

title: Going to New Jersey to Find America
description: FORGET about Billy Joel and his state of mind. Right now, the brains of New York, and Madison Avenue in particular, have come down with a case of Jersey fever.

title: Iraq: Recount to Take Weeks
description: Iraqs state election commission said Thursday that it could take up to three weeks to complete a partial recount of votes from last months parliamentary election, a time frame that extends the countrys political uncertainty and makes it very unlikely that a new government will be seated by the end of August, when the remaining American combat troops are scheduled to withdraw from the country. Iraqis voted March 7, but the post-election jockeying has continued, with parties trying to form coalitions and pursuing fraud allegations. On Thursday eight people were killed when a car bomb exploded near a liquor store in southwest Baghdad, according to police and medical officials, The Associated Press reported.

title: All Souls Rising
description: It was an art critic who coined the term magic realism, to describe a new wave of painting in 1920s Germany. The work departed from the moody Expressionism of the day, emphasizing material reality even as it unlocked an elusive otherworldliness in the arrangement of everyday objects. Sometimes, though, the fantastic rubbed elbows with the real: in one painting, a fat general nonchalantly shares a table with headless men in tuxedos.

title: Russia: Bombing Suspect Is Killed
description: Russian authorities announced on Thursday that they had killed a militant who they said assisted in the March 29 suicide bombings in Moscows metro. An official told the Interfax news service that the man, Akhmet Rabadanov, in his mid-30s, had been captured on surveillance cameras in the metro on the morning two women from Dagestan blew themselves up, killing 40 commuters and wounding dozens more. The official, who spoke on condition of anonymity, said Mr. Rabadanov had returned to Dagestan, where he was kept under surveillance. He was killed with another man on Monday when they were stopped by the traffic police and opened fire, the police told Interfax.

title: Europe Now Moving Swiftly on Greek Rescue Plan
description: European leaders raced Thursday to complete their part of a long-delayed financial rescue package for Greece, hoping to head off a chain reaction against other heavily indebted European nations that could turn into a financial crisis across the Continent, Nichols Kulish and Dan Bilefsky of The New York Times report.

title: Three Derby Trainers, Each One of a Kind
description: Louisville, Ky.

title: Watching and Waiting, the U.S. Defers to Europe on a Debt Crisis
description: WASHINGTON

title: Mets Versus Halladay Was Years in the Making
description: The Mets were in an ornery mood on July 16, 2000. A quirk in the interleague schedule had them playing the first game of a series on a Sunday afternoon, and they lost in Toronto, 7-3, falling six games back in the National League East.

title: Stopping Arizona
description: A fight is brewing over Arizonas new law that turns all of the states Latinos, even legal immigrants and citizens, into criminal suspects. And this is not a local fight. The poison is spreading; there is talk in Texas of passing a version of the Arizona statute.

title: The Cost of Delay
description: When the European Union and the International Monetary Fund first talked about a $60 billion rescue for Greece it looked as though that might be enough to calm Europes panicky markets. Then Germany dragged its feet, and investors raced to dump Greek bonds and bonds from the financially troubled Portugal and Spain.

title: Apples Chief Makes Case Against Flash
description: Steven P. Jobs, Apples chief executive, posted a 1,700-word letter on Apples Web site on Thursday, explaining the companys decision not to allow the multimedia software Adobe Flash on Apples mobile devices, including the iPhone and iPad.

title: Touching Up Camden Yards, Not Touching Its Character
description: BALTIMORE  Hard to believe, but Oriole Park at Camden Yards is nearly two decades old. Its brick facade, its asymmetrical field and its many old-time touches were so different when they were unveiled in 1992  and so widely imitated since then  that the ballpark still seems fresh today.

title: Montreal Canadiens Make Progress by Blocking Shots
description: WASHINGTON  Scott Gomez was headed down a long corridor to the Montreal Canadiens bus Wednesday night when a man stopped him to offer congratulations for helping the Canadiens oust the Washington Capitals from the Stanley Cup playoffs.

title: Unions Hold a Rally to Protest Wall Street
description: As the Senate began debate on a financial overhaul bill, thousands of union members pressed for higher taxes on the nations banks and a bigger jobs program in a rally in Lower Manhattan on Thursday.

title: No Rest for a Busy Masseur
description: In My Sleep is meant to be Hitchcockian  the writer and director, Allen Wolf, more or less says so in his directors statement  and maybe it is, if you think of it as, say, Hitchcocks senior project for film school. Mr. Wolf, in his feature film debut, generates a few genuine scares but he doesnt yet have the style to pull off the kind of lightly surreal comic thriller that hes trying for.

title: Pakistan, in Shift, Weighs Attack on Militant Lair
description: This article is by Sabrina Tavernise, Carlotta Gall and Ismail Khan.

title: Democrats Tweak Bank Bill to Preclude Bailouts
description: WASHINGTON  The Senate opened debate on Thursday on a far-reaching financial regulation bill, and Democrats moved quickly to demonstrate that the legislation would not provide any future taxpayer bailouts of failing financial companies  answering a Republican criticism that the Democrats had dismissed as false.

title: The Euro Trap
description: Not that long ago, European economists used to mock their American counterparts for having questioned the wisdom of Europes march to monetary union. On the whole, declared an article published just this past January, the euro has, thus far, gone much better than many U.S. economists had predicted.

title: Will Other Bidders Emerge for Palm?
description: As my colleague Ashlee Vance and I reported on Wednesday, Palm may not have been able to stay afloat in the smartphone industry as a standalone company. But the company has a strong trump card to keep it from going under entirely.

title: U.S. Report on Afghan War Finds Few Gains in 6 Months
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  A Pentagon report on the last six months in Afghanistan portrays an Afghan government with limited credibility among its people, a still active if not growing insurgency and an enormous reliance on American troops to train, outfit and finance the countrys defense forces for the foreseeable future.

title: Berkshire Hathaways Derivatives Exposure
description: Warren Buffett says he loves simple things like ice cream. But some 40,000 shareholders at Berkshire Hathaways annual meeting in Nebraska this weekend may hear a lot about complex derivatives.

title: Stranded Tourists Fall Into a Surgical Trap
description: A must-see for coprophiliacs and spanking enthusiasts, The Human Centipede (First Sequence) may be the years first mainstream fetish movie. Whether its writer and director, Tom Six, has more on his mind than mere titillation is debatable; either way this twisted, hammy bio-horror is sufficiently original to lure even the most satiated genre fans.

title: A New Approach to Aid
description: The basic truth of foreign aid is that helping people is far, far harder than it looks. Anybody who travels in the developing world has seen projects that have been abandoned, or encountered officials who have enriched themselves. One study in Chad found that less than 10 percent of health care aid actually found its way to the clinics it was intended to help.

title: Australia Fights Tobacco With Taxes and Plain Packs
description: Australia could become the first nation to ban brand images and colors on cigarette packages under a wide-ranging set of antismoking measures that the government unveiled Thursday.

title: Cross in the Desert
description: A badly divided Supreme Court has overturned a good ruling against a cross that sits on federal land. The opinions did not provide much guidance but, over all, are likely to encourage those who want to entangle government and religion.

title: Big Teddy Bear in Mosleys Camp Is at Home in Gym
description: LAS VEGAS  Naazim Richardson cuts an imposing figure, his arms the size of pony kegs, his full beard long turned gray, his baritone voice dispensing wisdom culled from a lifetime spent in boxing gyms.

title: A Fillys Chance to Rekindle Her Magic
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky.  A year ago Friday, a buzz built throughout the afternoon about an extraordinary filly that was destined to do something spectacular in the Kentucky Oaks. Her name was Rachel Alexandra, and for weeks she had produced workouts that were both ethereal and supersonic and had put to shame the colts getting ready for the Kentucky Derby.

title: As Greek Drama Plays Out, Where Is Europe?
description: WASHINGTON  With new European Union leaders practically invisible and some national leaders acting largely for domestic political reasons, the burden of shaping a rapid and credible restructuring program for Greece has fallen primarily to the International Monetary Fund  exactly where proud European Union leaders had insisted it should not be.

title: First Legal Challenges to New Arizona Law
description: The first legal challenges to Arizonas stringent new anti-illegal-immigration law were filed Thursday in federal court in Phoenix and Tucson, heralding a legal battle that could take months, if not years, to resolve.

title: World Cup Gets Closer and U.S. Roster Remains Unsettled
description: Coach Bob Bradley is not ready to settle on the United States team for the World Cup. But 16 to 18 spots on the roster are pretty much locked up, some days a little higher, Bradley said, and he will use his own calculus  more alchemy than science  to arrive at the team he will take to South Africa this summer.

title: Puerto Rican Lenders Face Their Own Crisis
description: The latest American banking crisis is taking shape far from Wall Street and the empty subdivisions that stretch across the Sun Belt. The trouble this time is in Puerto Rico, the Caribbean commonwealth whose banks have been laid low by economic woes that make the mainlands recession seem mild, Eric Dash of The New York Times reports.

title: Eastern N.B.A. Powers Wait and Wonder About Nagging Issues
description: INDEPENDENCE, Ohio  In each playoff series, the advancing team encounters moments to put away and ponder as it gains knowledge along the way. In their first-round matchups, the Eastern Conferences powerhouses rarely gleaned that knowledge from the games outcomes.

title: A Toxic Anger
description: When he arrived in Albany almost eight years ago, State Senator Kevin Parker was known as the intelligent and charming Brooklyn Democrat with a bright future. Now he is known as the man with frightening rages that could erupt at any time and on almost any subject.

title: U.S. Said to Open Criminal Inquiry Into Goldman
description: Federal prosecutors have opened an investigation into trading at Goldman Sachs, raising the possibility of criminal charges against the Wall Street giant, according to people familiar with the matter.

title: House Approves Puerto Rico Plebiscite
description: The House passed legislation today that would allow voters in Puerto Rico to weigh in on the territorys relationship with the United States.

title: Bitten
